title: Startime International
text:
Startime International is a <a href="record%20label">record label</a> founded in 2000 by Isaac Green, owned by <a href="Sony%20Music">Sony Music Entertainment</a>, based in New York City, and distributed by <a href="Columbia%20Records">Columbia Records</a>. Its roster includes <a href="Foster%20the%20People">Foster the People</a>, <a href="Coin%20%28band%29">Coin</a>, <a href="Natalie%20Prass">Natalie Prass</a>, <a href="Bully%20%28band%29">Bully</a>, Made Violent, <a href="Lewis%20Del%20Mar">Lewis Del Mar</a>, and <a href="The%20Big%20Moon">The Big Moon</a>.
History.
Green moved to Brooklyn and out of his apartment started the label, armed with one band, the <a href="French%20Kicks">French Kicks</a>. Startime's first release was the Kick's EP "<a href="Young%20Lawyer">Young Lawyer</a>" in late <a href="2000%20in%20music">2000</a>, and since then the label's roster has grown significantly with bands picked by Green not for their marketability but for sheer talent. This has paid off with a lot of indie cred points, and with more major labels looking to sign away Startime's acts like <a href="Brendan%20Benson">Brendan Benson</a> and <a href="The%20Walkmen">The Walkmen</a>. A compilation of Startime acts has been released, <a href="http%3A//www.startimerecords.com/supercuts.html">"Supercuts"</a>.
